threat_description: This threat involves unauthorized transactions using card-not-present (CNP) data, typically through online platforms, without the physical card being present.

components.name: Payment Gateway Exploitation
components.description: Exploiting vulnerabilities in the payment gateway to execute unauthorized transactions.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper authentication mechanisms can be exploited to bypass security controls.
Improper certificate validation can lead to man-in-the-middle attacks.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper input validation can lead to cross-site scripting attacks.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SQL injection vulnerabilities due to improper input sanitization.

components.name: User Account Compromise
components.description: Gaining unauthorized access to user accounts to perform fraudulent transactions.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Insufficiently protected credentials can be exploited to gain unauthorized access.
Use of hard-coded credentials can lead to unauthorized access.
Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities can be exploited to perform unauthorized actions.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Open redirect vulnerabilities can be used to redirect users to malicious sites.

threat: Compromise System Interfaces and Authentication Mechanisms
threat_description: This threat involves unauthorized access, data manipulation, or service disruption through the compromise of system interfaces (e.g., APIs, message brokers, web servers) and authentication mechanisms (e.g., identity verification, access controls). Attackers may exploit vulnerabilities in these components to breach systems, manipulate data, or disrupt services, leading to significant operational and security impacts.

components.name: Authentication and Authorization Systems
components.description: Systems managing user authentication and access controls, critical for preventing unauthorized access.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper authentication allows attackers to bypass security controls.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing authentication for critical functions allows unauthorized access.
Hard-coded credentials can be exploited to gain unauthorized access.
Improper access control can allow unauthorized data access.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-732: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Incorrect permissions can lead to unauthorized access.

components.name: Data Storage and Management
components.description: Systems storing and managing sensitive data, vulnerable to unauthorized access.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SQL injection can allow unauthorized data access.
Improper data handling can expose sensitive information.
Improper input validation can lead to data breaches.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-116: Improper Encoding or Escaping of Output
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper encoding can enable data leakage.

components.name: Integration Interfaces
components.description: Interfaces such as API gateways and message brokers that facilitate system communication.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Uncontrolled resource use can lead to denial of service.
Deserialization of untrusted data can disrupt services.
Improper privilege management can enable disruptive actions.
Improper access control can allow service disruption.

components.name: Web Application Components
components.description: Components of the web application that can be targeted to disrupt services.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Uncontrolled resource use can cause denial of service.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-404: Improper Resource Shutdown or Release
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper resource handling can disrupt services.

components.name: Data Storage and Management
components.description: Systems storing and managing sensitive data, vulnerable to unauthorized manipulation.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SQL injection can enable data manipulation.
Exposure can facilitate data tampering.
Improper validation can allow data manipulation.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-116: Improper Encoding or Escaping of Output
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper encoding can enable injection attacks.

components.name: Authentication and Authorization Systems
components.description: Systems managing authentication and authorization, which can be manipulated to alter access.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper authentication can allow identity manipulation.
Hard-coded credentials can be exploited to manipulate access.
Improper access control can enable unauthorized data changes.
Incorrect permissions can allow data manipulation.

threat: Unauthorized Access to Systems Through Third-Party Integrations
threat_description: Exploiting vulnerabilities in third-party services to gain unauthorized access to systems and data.

components.name: Third-Party Authentication
components.description: Exploiting weaknesses in third-party authentication services to gain unauthorized access.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper handling of OAuth tokens.
Failure to properly authenticate users.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposure of sensitive information through API keys.
Insufficiently protected credentials.

components.name: Data Storage
components.description: Compromising third-party data storage services to access sensitive data.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper access control configuration.

components.name: Third-Party Service Dependency

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper verification of DNS data authenticity.

threat_description: This threat involves executing transactions that do not adhere to established compliance standards, potentially leading to legal and financial repercussions.

components.name: Transaction Processing
components.description: The system responsible for processing financial transactions.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper Input Validation can lead to non-compliant transactions.
Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) can be used to conduct unauthorized transactions.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing Authentication for Critical Function can allow unauthorized transaction processing.

threat_description: Unauthorized access or exposure of sensitive personal data, leading to violations of data privacy laws and regulations.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Use of a broken or risky cryptographic algorithm can compromise data security.

threat_description: An insider with access to non-public financial or strategic information uses this data to make trades in the stock market, gaining an unfair advantage and potentially manipulating market conditions.

threat_description: Exploiting vulnerabilities in credit card reward systems to gain unauthorized benefits or rewards.

threat_description: An attacker attempts to bypass biometric authentication mechanisms to gain unauthorized access to a system or data.

threat_description: An attempt to disrupt the operations of a fintech ecosystem, potentially causing financial loss, reputational damage, and operational downtime.

components.name: Payment Processing
components.description: Targeting the payment processing systems to intercept or alter transactions.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SQL Injection vulnerabilities in backend servers can be exploited to manipulate payment data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing Authentication for Critical Function in backend servers can allow unauthorized access to payment processing.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper Input Validation can lead to cross-site scripting attacks affecting payment data.

components.name: User Account Management
components.description: Compromising user accounts to damage the reputation of the fintech service.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper Authentication can allow unauthorized access to user accounts.
Use of Hard-coded Credentials can lead to unauthorized access to user accounts.
Improper Authorization can allow users to perform actions beyond their permissions.
